intro: Erycibe elliptilimba, commonly known as the broad-leafed erycibe, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety pubescence. Its flowers are typically showy, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds.
